summary: This document is the FY-2019 Annual Training schedule for staff at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It details an 8-week training program from March to May 2019, covering topics such as ethics, inmate supervision, PREA (sexual abuse prevention), use of force, and firearms training. The document is significant as it outlines the standard training regimen for correctional staff at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held and died in 2019.

events.title: Start of MCC NY Annual Training
events.description: Beginning of the 8-week FY-2019 Annual Training program for Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York staff.

events.title: Final Training Day
events.description: The scheduled final day of the FY-2019 Annual Training program.

locations: 26 Federal Plaza, 6th Floor, Classroom J or I, New York, NY
keyFacts: The Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York conducted its FY-2019 Annual Training from March 4 to May 3, 2019.
Training topics included the Sexually Abusive Behavior Prevention & Intervention Program (PREA), use of force, inmate discipline, and firearms training.
Firearms training for staff was scheduled to take place at FCI Danbury.
This was the standard annual training schedule for correctional staff at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated in 2019.
